column2: Ghazali, G. M. & McPherson, G. E.
column5: Questionnaire developed based on O'Neill's (2001) survey on musical participation,McPherson and Davidson's (2002) research and Eccles' motivation constructs (1993; paper 401). Five motivational constructs (difficulty, importance, usefulness, interesting, enjoyment) assessed. Designed to compare attitudes towards music across ethinicities and religious groups to assess how they are influenced by socialisation factors.
column13: full scale not available but the paper is focused on instrumental training and learning music in school
column15: comparison across cultures
column17: authors mention that two versions of the scale (in Malay and English) were validated in a pilot study
column18: 7 point likert: importance, enjoyment, difficulty, interestingness, usefulness
column19: y: for 5 different motivation constructs, learning music in school M ranged from 4.28-4.71 and SD ranged from 1.73-1.92
column28: young readers; dyslexia
column29: language skills and quality of translation could have affected results here
column34: shorter scale might improve attention and engagement
column41: ethnicity and religion: malay muslim, chinese buddhist, chinese christian, indian hindu, indian christian
column49: instrument learning groups: currently learning an instrument, ceased learning an instrument, never learnt an instrument and by
column100: interesting test of expectancy-value theory argument that values and beliefs change across social groups
